revised_title: High-Speed Liquid Jet Mechanics and Decompression Phenomena
tldr: This article investigates the mechanics of high-speed liquid jets using experimental and theoretical methods. The authors study the emergence and flight of supersonic liquid jets, examining the effects of decompression, drag, and Taylor instability. They also explore the formation of a spray shroud around the jet core and the role of converging nozzles in constraining the front of the liquid packet. The research provides a comprehensive understanding of the jet's history from initial decompression to the breakup of liquid slugs.
